questions.question: 1.Given different samples are cold rolled to x % deformation; Sample A: 20 %, Sample B: 30 %, Sample C: 40 %, Sample D: 50 %. Which of the following is correct?

answers.a: % elongation of A < % elongation of B
answers.b: Yield Strength of C > Yield Strength of D
answers.c: Tensile Strength of D > Tensile Strength of A
answers.d: Elastic modulus of D > Elastic modulus of C

questions.question: 2.Which of the following statements is incorrect w.r.t. strain hardening?

answers.a: It is related to the elastic deformation
answers.d: Motion of dislocation is hindered by the presence of other dislocations

questions.question: 3.Which of the following decreases due to strain hardening?

answers.c: Ductility (% elongation or strain to failure)

questions.question: 4.Consider an aluminum plate has been subjected to 20 % cold rolling. Rectangular Tensile specimens (thickness: 5 mm and width: 10 mm) were cut from the rolled plate and then subjected to tensile test. If the load at yield point is 1000 N, what would be the yield strength?
5.The temperature below which cold working of metal is carried out is called:?
6.Which of the following cannot be used for work hardening?
